metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10011 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
authfile.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not properly consider the effects of realloc on buffer contents, which might allow local users to obtain sensitive private-key information by leveraging access to a privilege-separated child process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4ubuntu2.4').
